results.title: Points in space
results.creator_credit: Merce Cunningham, Elliot Caplan, Bob Lockyer, Cunningham Dance Foundation and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merce Cunningham Dance Company = Cunningham Dance Foundation”.
This critically acclaimed collaboration for the screen by choreographer Merce Cunningham, composer John Cage, and filmmaker Elliot Caplan, features the BBC documentary interviews with Cunningham, Cage and members of the company, as well as scenes from rehearsals in New York and London that take the viewer through the complexities - and exhilaration - of bringing new dance to television. The second half of the program features ‘Points in Space’, performed by Merce Cunningham his Dance Company. Reference: http://www.merce.org/filmvideo.html
results.creator_credit_for_label: Merce Cunningham, Elliot Caplan, Bob Lockyer, Cunningham Dance Foundation and BBC-TV

results.title: Merce Cunningham & Company
results.creator_credit: Benoit Jacquot, Cunningham Dance Foundation and L'Institut National de L'Audiovisuel (INA)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Merce Cunningham Dance Company = Cunningham Dance Foundation”.
This documentary explores Merce Cunningham’s method of choreography, including his employment of random methods through use of the I Ching, his collaboration with composer John Cage and his relationship with the dancers in his Company. Cunningham candidly reveals his ideas on dance through interviews, and footage from rehearsal at the Cunningham studios. Included are dance excerpts from “Trails,” “Scramble,” “Aeon,” “Quartet”, “Suite For Five”, “Roadrunners” and “Fractions”. In English with French with English subtitles. Reference: http://www.merce.org/filmvideo.html
results.creator_credit_for_label: Benoit Jacquot, Cunningham Dance Foundation and L’Institut National de L’Audiovisuel (INA)

group_works.title: Inland with McDouall Stuart
group_works.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films

results.title: Inland with McDouall Stuart
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Men of stamina”.
The first part of the film tells the story of Stuart’s three attempts, the last successful, to cross the continent from south to north. The second part describes today in the Northern Territory. A description of the country Stuart opened up suggesting that his prophecies are coming true.

results.title: The Blue mountains crossing - 1813
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Men of stamina”.
Takes the students from the original great journal of exploration by Blaxland, Wentworth and Lawson through to the present day development deriving from that exploration. No other credits available.

results.title: Two lives
results.creator_credit: Duc Hoang Nguyen, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Remembering the past and looking forward to the future
results.creator_credit: Cuong Manh Pham, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: A story of escape by boat from Vietnam to a Malaysian refugee camp, and then to Australia in 1986 where Cuong Manh Pham eventually made a new life, reuniting with his family in 1990.
